bank.account.application

Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • bank.account.application.Customer

  • public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
    Overview: A Customer has a specific mutable balance in their account and can have any three level of membership. This class, although called customer refers to the bank account that a specific customer has. This class is mutable, since all its instance variables can be changed. Abstract Function: AF(r) = r.customerFile.userName + r.customerFile.password + r.currentLevel Rep Invariant: RI(r) = r.username != NULL && r.password != null

        public Customer(java.lang.String username,
                java.lang.String password)
         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a Customer account with no balance. Effects: Creates a Customer account with zero balance. Requires: username and password is not null
        Parameters:
        username - The username of this customer
        password - The password of this customer
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • Customer

        public Customer(double accountBalance)
        Creates a Customer account with specified initial values. Effects: Creates a customer object with specified values. Requires: accountBalance is a real number, not a String
        Parameters:
        accountBalance - The account balance to initialize the customer with.

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Login the customer to their account if the username and password are valid. Effects: Checks if the username and password match and sets the success flag respectively. Requires: username and password must not be null.

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Logs out the Customer from their account. Effects: Sets the successful flag to false.

      • addMoney

        public void addMoney(double money)
        Add money to the customer's balance. Effects: Adds the specified amount of money to this customer's balance if sufficient funds exist. Requires: money must be a positive value. It must be a double value.

      • useMoney

        public void useMoney(double money)
        This is to make online purchases. Online purchases must be 50 dollars or more in order to make the purchase. Effects: Remove specified amount of money from this customer's balance by making a purchase. Requires: money must be a positive value.

      • withdrawMoney

        public void withdrawMoney(double money)
        Withdraw the specified amount of money from this customer's account. Effects: Withdraw specified money. Requires: money must be a positive value

        public boolean RepOk()
